synthesized_claims.statement: Healthy human hepatocytes synthesize GSH at 0.5–1.2 μmol/g liver/hr, but this drops >2x in NAFLD/alcohol-related liver disease due to limited cysteine availability and ATP depletion.
synthesized_claims.mechanism: GSH synthesis is rate-limited by γ-glutamylcysteine ligase (GCL) activity, which depends on ATP and cysteine; metabolic stress reduces both.
synthesized_claims.falsifiable_by: Direct measurement of GCL activity and GSH flux in healthy vs. diseased human liver biopsies under controlled conditions.
synthesized_claims.chunk_text: Healthy human hepatocytes synthesize GSH at 0.5–1.2 μmol/g liver/hr, but this drops >2x in NAFLD/alcohol-related liver disease due to limited cysteine availability and ATP depletion.

synthesized_claims.statement: CBD-VDAC1 binding reversible (t_off <<12hr); allosteric gating resets post-dissociation.
synthesized_claims.mechanism: Non-covalent H-bond/hydrophobic; VDAC dynamics (ns-μs gating) >> drug residence (<hr, per k_off~Kd/k_on).
synthesized_claims.falsifiable_by: Washout electrophysiol. showing persistent gating change >1hr.
synthesized_claims.chunk_text: CBD-VDAC1 binding reversible (t_off <<12hr); allosteric gating resets post-dissociation.

synthesized_claims.statement: 7-OH-CBD accumulates to 2–5x parent CBD levels at steady-state (50mg/day), contributing meaningful VDAC occupancy due to slower clearance and comparable affinity.
synthesized_claims.mechanism: 7-OH-CBD has ~3x longer half-life than CBD (18–32 hr vs. 6–12 hr) and similar VDAC1 affinity (estimated Kd ~10–20 μM).
synthesized_claims.falsifiable_by: Steady-state plasma/hepatic 7-OH-CBD levels in chronic dosing studies, with VDAC1 occupancy assays in liver homogenates.
synthesized_claims.chunk_text: 7-OH-CBD accumulates to 2–5x parent CBD levels at steady-state (50mg/day), contributing meaningful VDAC occupancy due to slower clearance and comparable affinity.

synthesized_claims.statement: The null hypothesis (progressive GSH depletion at 50mg/day in healthy liver) is likely defeated. The safety margin is ~5-10x for GSH flux but narrows to ~2-3x in compromised liver.
synthesized_claims.mechanism: Daily GSH synthesis vastly exceeds estimated oxidative load from low fractional VDAC occupancy; however, compromised liver loses both synthesis capacity and baseline GSH reserves simultaneously.
synthesized_claims.falsifiable_by: Longitudinal clinical data showing declining GSH/GSSG ratios or rising ALT over 3-6 months of 50mg/day CBD in healthy volunteers. ───
synthesized_claims.chunk_text: The null hypothesis (progressive GSH depletion at 50mg/day in healthy liver) is likely defeated. The safety margin is ~5-10x for GSH flux but narrows to ~2-3x in compromised liver.

synthesized_claims.statement: At 50mg/day oral CBD, steady-state hepatic [CBD] ~0.1-0.5μM (plasma 0.05-0.2μM × liver enrichment), VDAC occ <5%, ROS load <<1 μmol/g liver/day (<2% GSH capacity).
synthesized_claims.mechanism: F=0.06-0.19 → ss_CBD = (dose·F / CL) / (1-e^{-kτ}); first-pass transient; ROS~k·[CBD]·mito# but sub-Kd occupancy yields negligible integrated load vs 50-100μmol/g/day capacity.
synthesized_claims.falsifiable_by: Human PK-PD with hepatic ROS measured >5% GSH use.
synthesized_claims.chunk_text: At 50mg/day oral CBD, steady-state hepatic [CBD] ~0.1-0.5μM (plasma 0.05-0.2μM × liver enrichment), VDAC occ <5%, ROS load <<1 μmol/g liver/day (<2% GSH capacity).

synthesized_claims.statement: Null defeated: no progressive GSH/VDAC/ATP cumulation at 50mg/day healthy liver.
synthesized_claims.mechanism: Reversible low-occupancy + GSH >> load; ATP deficit scales linearly/reverses, no compounding.
synthesized_claims.falsifiable_by: Serial biopsies showing GSH decline or VDAC dysfunction over 4wks. ───
synthesized_claims.chunk_text: Null defeated: no progressive GSH/VDAC/ATP cumulation at 50mg/day healthy liver.

synthesized_claims.statement: Safety margin >50x (TI>>10) in healthy liver; narrows to ~5-10x in compromised.
synthesized_claims.mechanism: Therapeutic 1-10μM >> chronic ss 0.1μM; threshold >20μM GSH drop requires >10x overload.
synthesized_claims.falsifiable_by: Chronic trials showing GSH <80% baseline at 50mg/day.
synthesized_claims.chunk_text: Safety margin >50x (TI>>10) in healthy liver; narrows to ~5-10x in compromised.

synthesized_claims.statement: At 50mg oral CBD/day (6–19% bioavailability), the daily ROS load exceeds 24hr GSH regeneration capacity in metabolically compromised livers, but not in healthy livers, assuming a safety margin of 2–5x.
synthesized_claims.mechanism: CYP450-mediated CBD metabolism generates ROS; GSH regeneration capacity (~12–24 μmol/g/day) may be saturated if ROS flux >0.5–1 μmol/g/hr (e.g., in NAFLD).
synthesized_claims.falsifiable_by: Longitudinal GSH/GSSG ratios in liver biopsies from healthy vs. NAFLD subjects dosed with 50mg CBD/day for 4+ weeks.
synthesized_claims.chunk_text: At 50mg oral CBD/day (6–19% bioavailability), the daily ROS load exceeds 24hr GSH regeneration capacity in metabolically compromised livers, but not in healthy livers, assuming a safety margin of 2–5x.

synthesized_claims.statement: Chronic sub-threshold CBD dosing causes cumulative ATP deficit independent of ROS/GSH status, due to persistent VDAC-mediated proton leak.
synthesized_claims.mechanism: Allosteric VDAC1 perturbation may uncouple ATP synthesis from ROS generation, allowing ATP depletion to compound even if GSH remains adequate.
synthesized_claims.falsifiable_by: Longitudinal ATP/ADP ratios in liver mitochondria from chronic CBD-dosed animals, with ROS/GSH clamped via NAC or BSO. --- ───
synthesized_claims.chunk_text: Chronic sub-threshold CBD dosing causes cumulative ATP deficit independent of ROS/GSH status, due to persistent VDAC-mediated proton leak.
